body.name: Arcanus
editorialReviews: Editorial Reviews Review ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ "Arcanus is an exciting blend of science fiction and fantasy, and Eke has skillfully established a robust foundation for a potentially captivating series. This novel comes highly recommended for both seasoned and budding fans of the genre." - Literary Titan
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Friday, February 23 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35. Order within 18 hrs 10 mins
body.description: Before the Great War, battles were fought and won with magic. Ina world where magic courses through the veins of every singlehuman being, a single mage could take on an army of thousands,and a single family could conquer an empire. But even magic couldnot hold back the tides of science and industry, and modern warfarewas born. Since then, the imperial powers of Russia and Great Britainhave begun amassing weapons of both magic and science in anarms race against each other. A tenuous peace has remained thanksto the efforts of Bastion, a global diplomatic organization of magesdedicated to maintaining order across the world.It is eighteen-year-old Kibo Kozlov’s dream to join Bastion, just likehis father before him. But some dreams aren’t meant to be, asKibo had never been able to control the weave of magic. He had nearlygiven up hope, that is until he stumbled upon a bizarre artifact that mightchange the course of history—both his and the world's.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A Captivating Blend of Magic and Science in a Thrilling Sci-Fi Adventure
reviews.reviewText: Arcanus by Ali K. Eke is a captivating sci-fi novel that combines elements of magic, science, and an alternate history to deliver an intriguing and immersive reading experience. Set in a world where magic and technology coexist, the story explores the consequences of an arms race between imperial powers and the delicate balance maintained by a global organization of mages known as Bastion.The author paints a vivid picture of a society on the brink of transformation, where magic and science clash in a battle for supremacy. The premise of a world where magic once ruled, but is now being challenged by the rise of modern warfare, adds a unique layer of tension and intrigue to the narrative. The contrast between the old ways and the emergence of new technologies creates a rich backdrop against which the story unfolds.The protagonist, Kibo Kozlov, is a relatable and determined character whose dreams of joining Bastion are initially hindered by his inability to control magic. This sets up an engaging personal journey as Kibo stumbles upon a mysterious artifact that holds the potential to reshape the world's future. Through Kibo's eyes, readers are taken on an adventure filled with discovery, danger, and self-discovery.The world-building in Arcanus is commendable, with a careful blend of magical elements and technological advancements. The author brings the settings to life, from the grand imperial powers of Russia and Great Britain to the intricate workings of Bastion itself. The intricacies of magic and the implications of its integration with science are explored, providing a rich and immersive backdrop for the unfolding events.Eke's writing style is fluid and descriptive, allowing readers to easily visualize the scenes and empathize with the characters. The pacing of the story is well-maintained, with a balance of action, suspense, and moments of introspection. The plot unfolds gradually, gradually revealing secrets and building towards a climactic finale.While the novel offers a fascinating premise and engaging characters, there are moments where certain subplots or character arcs could have been further explored or developed. These missed opportunities slightly dampen the overall impact of the story but do not detract significantly from the overall enjoyment.In conclusion, Arcanus is a captivating sci-fi novel that blends magic, technology, and alternate history to create an immersive world filled with intrigue and adventure. Ali K. Eke's skillful storytelling, well-crafted world-building, and relatable characters make this book a compelling read for fans of the genre. If you're looking for a unique blend of magic and science in a richly imagined world, Arcanus is a book worth delving into.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars OK read but the ending is not working
reviews.reviewText: The author tried to create a baseline for magic. I suppose that was ok. The bad thing is that the author tried to pivot the storyline two-thirds through the book and it just doesn't work. The antagonists aren't interesting or meaningful. The last part of the story doesn't build on the main characters. There is also a mysterious secondary character that is vital to the story who helps the main character immensely that is not expanded on and mostly forgotten about. Parts of the book were OK, but it could use some work.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars a fun heroic story
reviews.reviewText: Every now and then I like to put aside my usual stack of unread mysteries, thrillers, and sci-fi, and try something a bit different. I'm glad I did when I read Arcanus, which threw a little bit of everything but kept its focus on the trials and tests these young people endured.This was an excellent story and I look forward to more from this author.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Impressive book+ interesting story
reviews.reviewText: I loved the plot of this book. I usually don’t read fiction books. However if I’m honest, I’m really glad that I read this book. The characters and plot elevate the story’s narrative. I cannot wait for the sequel to the book. Great book which I would recommend to my friends and others.
